interface.name: org.freedesktop.NetworkManager.VPN.Plugin
interface.tp:docstring: This interface is provided by plugins providing VPN services to the NetworkManager daemon.

method.name: Connect
method.tp:docstring: Tells the plugin to connect. Interactive secrets requests (eg, emitting the SecretsRequired signal) are not allowed.

arg.name: connection
arg.tp:docstring: Describes the connection to be established.

method.name: ConnectInteractive
method.tp:docstring: Tells the plugin to connect, allowing interactive secrets requests (eg the plugin is allowed to emit the SecretsRequired signal if the VPN service indicates that it needs additional secrets during the connect process).

arg.name: connection
arg.tp:docstring: Describes the connection to be established.

arg.name: details
arg.tp:docstring: Additional details about the Connect process.

method.name: NeedSecrets
method.tp:docstring: Asks the plugin whether the provided connection will require secrets to connect successfully.

arg.name: settings
arg.tp:docstring: Describes the connection that may need secrets.

arg.name: setting_name
arg.tp:docstring: The setting name within the provided connection that requires secrets, if any.

method.name: SetConfig
method.tp:docstring: Set generic connection details on the connection.

arg.name: config
arg.tp:docstring: Generic configuration details for the connection.

method.name: SetIp4Config
method.tp:docstring: Set IPv4 details on the connection.

arg.name: config
arg.tp:docstring: Ip4Config details for the connection. You must call SetConfig() before calling this.

method.name: SetIp6Config
method.tp:docstring: Set IPv6 details on the connection.

arg.name: config
arg.tp:docstring: Ip6Config details for the connection. You must call SetConfig() before calling this.

method.name: SetFailure
method.tp:docstring: Indicate a failure to the plugin.

signal.name: StateChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when the plugin state changes.

arg.name: state
arg.tp:docstring: The new state of the plugin.

signal.name: SecretsRequired
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted during an ongoing ConnectInteractive() request when the plugin has determined that new secrets are required. NetworkManager will then call the NewSecrets() method with a connection hash including the new secrets.

arg.name: message
arg.tp:docstring: Informational message, if any, about the request. For example, if a second PIN is required, could indicate to the user to wait for the token code to change until entering the next PIN.

arg.name: secrets
arg.tp:docstring: Array of strings of VPN secret names which the plugin thinks secrets may be required for, or other VPN-specific data to be processed by the VPN's front-end.

method.name: NewSecrets
method.tp:docstring: Called in response to a SecretsRequired signal to deliver updated secrets or other information to the plugin.

arg.name: connection
arg.tp:docstring: Describes the connection including the new secrets.

signal.name: Config
signal.tp:docstring: The plugin obtained generic configuration information.

signal.name: Ip4Config
signal.tp:docstring: The plugin obtained an IPv4 configuration.

signal.name: Ip6Config
signal.tp:docstring: The plugin obtained an IPv6 configuration.

signal.name: LoginBanner
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when the plugin receives a login banner from the VPN service.

signal.name: Failure
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when a failure in the VPN plugin occurs.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: Invalid IP configuration returned from the VPN plugin.
